data.title: Can't add items to dictionary variable in Visual Scripting
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 64 bits
Godot 3.0 Alpha 1
(and also tested in Godot 3.0 latest daily build)

**Issue description:**
When using visual script, I can't add items to a dictionary variable

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new variable in member panel, right click to edit it. After changing to _dictionary_ variable type, the value field becomes uneditable, there's also no icon to expand or make it editable in inspector panel like other types.

**Screenshot:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24779254/30462468-19b6aa3a-99f0-11e7-93d4-49a67d42aeba.png)

data.title: Control drag preview position error
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 Home, 64-bit, Godot 2.1.4
and
Ubuntu 17.04 x86-64, Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
set_drag_preview(control) was set for a node. A Camera2D node was also placed in the scene and set as current. The scene was executed.
When I drag the node, the drag preview does not accurately follow mouse position.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create node for scene root.
Place TextureFrame in scene.
Set texture as icon.png (included with godot)
Attach this script:

    extends TextureFrame
    
    const Drag  = preload("res://drag.gd")
    
    func _ready():
        pass
    
    func get_drag_data(p):
        var stack = Drag.new()
        var object = [self, stack]
        remove_child(stack)
        var drag_preview = Drag.new()
        drag_preview.set_size(Vector2(32, 32))
        set_drag_preview(drag_preview)
        return object

Place this script ("drag.gd") in res://

    extends Control
    
    var sprite
    
    const ICON_SIZE = 64
    func _init():
        sprite = Sprite.new()
        add_child(sprite)
        set_size(Vector2(ICON_SIZE, ICON_SIZE))
    
    func _ready():
        layout()
    
    func layout():
        sprite.set_scale(get_size()/ICON_SIZE)
        sprite.set_texture(preload("icon.png"))

Place Camera2D in scene and set to "Current"
When the project is executed the drag preview is off position the same amount that the current camera node is off from the root Viewport. If Camera2D node is positioned at x,y then the drag preview will be off by the same vector
**EDIT:**
This issue does not appear to be limited to the Camera2D/Control interaction. Control drag preview appears to not take extra positioning data from other nodes (Camera2D, CanvasLayer, etc) into account when rendering

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Control_Drag_Bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1304978/Control_Drag_Bug.zip)

data.title: Only do 'drive' discovery on X11
data.body:
As it turns out older versions of the Android NDK have mntent.h but not
a complete implementation. If it did work it would most likely give the
wrong results on Android anyway.

This commit enables the UNIX drive discovery only for X11

We also missed '/run/media' (default for gnome desktops) in the list of
places to look for 'drives' on Linux. Add that to the list also.

This fixes #11270

data.title: Enabled transform animations of skeleton bones by index NodePaths
data.body:
Transform animation tracks paths can now use the bones property of Skeleton in addition to using the bone name.

E.g. `Skeleton:bones/0`

data.title: Compile error with Recast.cpp for android template
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04.3, master branch 3f4062c

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
```
[ 90%] Compiling ==> thirdparty/recastnavigation/Recast/Source/Recast.cpp
thirdparty/recastnavigation/Recast/Source/Recast.cpp:26:10: fatal error: 'new' file not found
#include <new>
         ^~~~~
1 error generated.
scons: *** [thirdparty/recastnavigation/Recast/Source/Recast.android.opt.debug.armv7.neon.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
`scons platform=android tools=no` => fail
`scons platform=android tools=no android_stl=yes` => success

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

	x11
`
althought I have all the export variables setted up and everything installed correctly. Is there any other env variable besides "JAVA_HOME", "ANDROID_HOME" and "ANDROID_NDK_ROOT" that is not documented?

data.title: Nvidia: 3D view becomes unusable when editing a MeshInstance in the inspector
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
OS: Linux Mint 64bit
Godot Engine v3.0.alpha.custom_build.8c08f23
GPU: NVIDIA Corporation GF119M [GeForce 610M]
Graphics driver: nvidia-375.66

**Issue description:**
When editing the shape of a MeshInstance in the inspector, the 3D view goes black and is unusable until Godot is restarted.
![screenshot from 2017-09-14 15-51-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28710711/30433715-778528b6-9965-11e7-869c-bc0a390cfc55.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Add a MeshInstance to the scene
- For the MeshInstance, create a new shape
- Edit the shape

data.title: Fix errors in Python 3 build
data.body:
- Replaced tabs with spaces since Python 3 doesn't allow mixed indentation.
- Opened a header file in text mode (instead of binary mode) to avoid inserting manual byte/string conversions.

data.title: Texture created via editor has different flags than texture created via script
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
Nodes created via the editor (sprite -> texture -> load(file)) vs created via script (Sprite.new(), Texture.new(), Texture.load(file), etc.)
have different flags.  For sprite objects created in the editor, the get_texture.get_flags() returns 4, not the expected default of 7.

A separate but related issue: FLAGS_DEFAULT seems to create display display artifacts when the sprite size matches the texture size.  Two sprites next to each other with no gap,, may show one of the sprite's other edge, creating unwanted display artifacts.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a sprite node.
Load a texture.
Attach a script.
In the _ready(), add:

```python
print(get_texture.get_flags())  
var sprite = Sprite.new()  
var texture = ImageTexture.new()  
texture.load("res://icon.png")  
sprite.set_texture(texture)  
add_child(sprite)  
print(sprite.get_texture().get_flags())  
````

Result:  
4  
7

data.title: OGG only output in left speaker
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version:**
Windows 8, Godot 3.0alpha1

**Issue description:**
OGG only output in left speaker with AudioStreamPlayer and AudioStreamOGGVorbis

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create AudioStreamPlayer Node
Stream > Load > pick a ogg file
Check 'playing' in AudioStreamPlayer node
sound output only in left speaker

**Link to minimal example project:**
[ogg_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1302819/ogg_bug.zip)

data.title: Can't reselect bus effect if only one effect per bus
data.body:
**Versions**
Windows 8 64 bits, Godot 3.0alpha1

**Issue description:**
Can't reselect bus effect if only one effect per bus

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add one bus or more
Add one effect in each bus
Select effect in bus 1, select effect in bus 2 (the effect in bus 1 isn't deselected), impossible to select the effect of bus 1 anymore and tweak it in inspector

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7358899/30427545-7dc1a764-9950-11e7-9f09-51ad84c76887.png)
